content.raw:
This is probably due to the default hidden symbol visibility.  Player plugin drivers must provide a C "player_driver_init()" registration function, which the Player server finds and calls after dlopen-ing a plugin library.  The definition of player_driver_init() in GazeboDriver.cc is not exported with GAZEBO_VISIBLE, so Player fails when trying to load the plugin.

The Player driver class in GazeboDriver.hh is exported with GAZEBO_VISIBILE, so the registration function was probably just overlooked (there's no prototype for it in the header file).
content.html:
This is probably due to the default hidden symbol visibility. Player plugin drivers must provide a C "player_driver_init()" registration function, which the Player server finds and calls after dlopen-ing a plugin library. The definition of player_driver_init() in GazeboDriver.cc is not exported with GAZEBO_VISIBLE, so Player fails when trying to load the plugin.

The Player driver class in GazeboDriver.hh is exported with GAZEBO_VISIBILE, so the registration function was probably just overlooked (there's no prototype for it in the header file).
